review: Very simple to "install", if you can even call it that.  Just plug it in to an electrical outlet, plug one end of an HDMI cable into the TV and the other side into the Amazon Fire TV box.  It was a gift, so I didn't know much about it.  It works off your Wi-Fi, and immediately installed itself, checked for updates, and appeared on the TV Input list!  There are lots of choices.  My only "complaint" would be that you don't know which movies/games, etc. are "FREE" and which ones you have to pay for.  The only way to find out, is to choose that item.  Then you have to decide. One fun thing I wasn't expecting is that it automatically synced the pictures from my Kindle Fire and Amazon Fire phone to the TV.  You get to see the pictures or videos on "the big screen".  Only have it since Christmas.  Still learning, but so far, so good!
author: Donna  M. Green

review: I just love it and it is amazing how easy it was to hook up and use, I can easily move it between TVs in the house.  We love it, not sure how easy it would have been for someone who doesn't use Amazon all that much (although seems like everyone uses Amazon) and doesn't have the prime, but we love it.  It was a gift, something I probably wouldn't have purchased because it sounding too confusing.  I have been watching Downton Abbey and love catching up on other shows as well.  It was a wonderful gift.
